question: What is the name of the company receiving the notice that has proposed compliance and a warning?
raw_answer: Eastern Gas Transmission and Storage, Inc.
evidence_answer: Eastern Gas Transmission and Storage, Inc.

From November 15, 2021, to November 19, 2021, via on-site inspection, representatives of the 
Pipeline  and  Hazardous  Materials  Safety  Administration  (PHMSA),  Office  of  Pipeline  Safety 
(OPS),  pursuant  to  Chapter  601  of  49  United  States  Code  (U.S.C.)

probable violations and recommend that you be preliminarily assessed a civil penalty of $ 26,000 
as follows: 

Item number 
1 

PENALTY 
$ 26,000 

Warning Item 

With respect to Item 2, we have reviewed the circumstances and supporting documents involved 
in this case and have decided not to conduct additional enforcement action or penalty assessment 
proceedings at this time.

Following the receipt of this Notice, you have 30 days to  respond as described in the enclosed 
Response Options.

If you do not respond within 30 days of receipt of this Notice, this constitutes 
a  waiver  of  your  right  to  contest  the  allegations  in  this  Notice  and  authorizes  the  Associate 
Administrator for Pipeline Safety to find facts as alleged in this Notice without further notice to 
you and to issue a Final Order.

Enclosed as part of this Notice is a document entitled Response Options for Pipeline Operators in 
Enforcement  Proceedings.

material you submit in response to this enforcement action may be made publicly available.
